messages.subject: Re: Learning Styles
messages.messageBody:
<<I'm looking for a link to an online quiz to assess your child's learning
style?? Does anyone perhaps have it bookmarked??>>

Dalene,

Try Smarterkids.com - they have such a quiz.

...Lizz, who will do an intro...someday :-)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Learning Styles
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t know if it s the one you mean, but SmarterKids.Com has one. Just go to their homepage  and click the My Kids Store
messages.messageBody:
>I'm looking for a link to an online quiz to assess your child's
>learning style?? Does anyone perhaps have it bookmarked??
>
>Dalene


I don't know if it's the one you mean, but SmarterKids.Com has one.
Just go to their homepage <http://www.smarterkids.com/> and click the
"My Kids Store" link. You'll see an entire menu of things (early
development checklists, etc.). . .one of them is a learning style
analysis.

Misty Blagg

messages.subject: Learning Styles
messages.msgSnippet: ... For you and others that are interested in learning styles, i found the following link very useful!  To my surprise, Sterling s results showed his secondary
messages.messageBody:
> Date: Fri, 06 Aug 1999 17:45:08 -0700
> From: Lisa Fuller <eifuller@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
> Reply-to: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I'm new here

> From: Lisa Fuller <eifuller@...>
>
> I just wanted to add another resource for people with "active"
> learners. Howard Gardner wrote several books about different
> intelligences and how the different intelligences learn. It is
> slowly making its way through the ps system and hopefully things
> will change, but his books are interesting to read. According to his
> theory, it sounds like your children are kinesthetic learners, they
> have to be physically active in order to absorb information and
> learn. He lays out 7 total intelligences and they make sense. I
> think that even 7 is too limiting;) but at least it is a start.
>
> Lisa F.

For you and others that are interested in learning styles, i found
the following link very useful! To my surprise, Sterling's results
showed his secondary learning style as Physical. I expected that one
to come out as his primary. Then i expected his secondary to be a
toss-up between several.

Enjoy!

http://www.smarterkids.com/mysmarterkids/stylesurvey.asp
Learning Styles Survey
This Learning Styles Survey is inspired by the Howard
Gardner theory of Multiple Intelligences. Click here for more
information. Please complete the 28 questions to discover which
learning styles best describe your child. We can then recommend
products based on how your child learns most effectively. All
information will be kept absolutely confidential.
Michele Moss
Infinity Computer Solutions
Great Falls, MT
406-727-5609
http://www.icstech.net
